main event: A white to red object in the shape of an inverted raindrop, the size of a grapefruit, was observed moving slowly eastward in Boonville, Missouri on April 26, 1958.
interesting points: The object was observed through binoculars.
The object was in sight for an undetermined amount of time.
The object was moving very slowly eastward.
The weather conditions were clear with unlimited visibility.
sighted object: an inverted raindrop-shaped object, white to red in color, the size of a grapefruit
